question: Which technology company has partnered with the National Basketball Association (NBA) to set virtual fans in the game stands?
explanation:
Technology giant Microsoft has partnered with the National Basketball Association (NBA) to set virtual fans in the game stands.
Microsoft will use its newly launched Teams app and 17-foot-tall LED screens to put around 300 virtual fans in the stands of each game. Fans can login the Teams app and use the "Together mode", which simulates a group of people sitting in a room.
